╔═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║                  CCTV SURVEILLANCE ANALYSIS REPORT                            ║
║                    SAI APARTMENT COMPLEX, PUNE                                ║
╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

REPORT REFERENCE:        CCTV-16-MAR-2025-002
REPORT DATE/TIME:        16 March 2025, 22:00 hours
CASE REFERENCE:          FIR 121/2025
INCIDENT DATE:           16 March 2025


SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM DETAILS:
────────────────────────────
System Type:             HD IP Camera Network
Number of Cameras:       6 (covering complex)
Primary Camera:          CAM-04 (Rear Exit)
Resolution:              1920 x 1080 pixels (Full HD)
Frame Rate:              30 frames per second (fps)
Recording Format:        H.264 Video Codec
Storage:                 Digital Video Recorder (DVR)
Recording Period:        24/7 continuous


CAMERA SPECIFICATIONS (CAM-04):
───────────────────────────────
Camera Type:             Fixed Dome IP Camera
Model:                   Hikvision DS-2CD2143G0-I
Field of View:           90 degrees (Horizontal)
Focal Length:            2.8mm
Night Vision:            Infrared (IR) - 30 meters
Resolution:              1920 x 1080 @ 30fps
Installation Location:   Rear exit entrance, height 2.5 meters


VIDEO ANALYSIS TIME WINDOW:
────────────────────────────
Total Duration Analyzed: 30 minutes (20:50 PM - 21:20 PM)
Critical Incident Period: 21:02 PM - 21:04 PM (2 minutes)
Video Quality:           Clear, good lighting conditions
Lighting Conditions:     Outdoor evening, building exterior lights on


TIMELINE OF EVENTS (FROM CCTV ANALYSIS):
─────────────────────────────────────────

TIME: 21:02 PM (21:02 hours)
EVENT: Unknown male approaches rear exit area
DESCRIPTION:
  • Male wearing black hoodie (very distinctive)
  • Blue denim jeans
  • Dark shoes
  • Height approximately 5'8"-5'10"
  • Build: Athletic/lean
  • Walking with purpose toward rear exit
  • Face partially obscured by hoodie hood
  • Visible scar on left cheek (clearly visible in footage)
  • Appears to be waiting or watching before approaching

TIME: 21:03 PM (21:03 hours)
EVENT: Neha Deshmukh enters frame at rear exit
DESCRIPTION:
  • Female walking toward apartment building from street
  • Carrying brown leather handbag
  • Casual walking pace
  • Appears unaware of male's presence
  • Walking alone

TIME: 21:03:15 PM *** CRITICAL MOMENT ***
EVENT: Accused suddenly approaches victim and attempts handbag snatch
DESCRIPTION:
  • Male suddenly closes distance to victim
  • Aggressive movement toward handbag
  • Reaches for victim's handbag with both hands
  • Victim resists immediately, tries to retain handbag
  • Struggle ensues (approximately 10-15 seconds)

TIME: 21:03:30 PM
EVENT: Accused pushes victim forcefully
DESCRIPTION:
  • Male applies forceful push to victim's upper body
  • Push directed toward right shoulder/chest area
  • Victim falls backward to ground
  • Victim lands hard on right side (shoulder and elbow impact)
  • Accused attempts to grab handbag during fall

TIME: 21:03:45 PM
EVENT: Victim retains handbag despite fall
DESCRIPTION:
  • Despite fall, victim maintains grip on handbag
  • Victim on ground, holding handbag to body
  • Handbag strap appears damaged/torn
  • Accused realizes theft unsuccessful

TIME: 21:04 PM
EVENT: Accused flees scene
DESCRIPTION:
  • Accused abandons snatching attempt
  • Runs away from scene at high speed
  • Direction: Toward main road (FC Road)
  • Speed: Approximately 15-20 km/h
  • Does not look back
  • Quickly exits camera frame

TIME: 21:05 PM
EVENT: Witness assistance and first responders
DESCRIPTION:
  • Witness (Rahul Patil) enters frame from building
  • Rushes to assist fallen victim
  • Security guard appears on scene
  • Emergency services likely contacted


KEY FORENSIC OBSERVATIONS:
───────────────────────────
1. SUSPECT IDENTIFICATION:
   • Clear facial view in multiple frames
   • Distinctive black hoodie (primary identifier)
   • Visible scar on left cheek (precise identifier)
   • Build, height, gait all recorded
   • Positive identification possible if suspect apprehended

2. ATTACK PATTERN:
   • Single, rapid attack (total duration ~2 minutes)
   • Sudden approach suggests either waiting or exceptional timing
   • No hesitation or uncertainty in criminal action
   • Suggests prior experience or observation

3. VICTIM'S RESISTANCE:
   • Victim immediately resisted (positive action)
   • Did not comply with thief's demands
   • Successfully retained handbag despite fall
   • Victim's presence of mind prevented successful theft

4. SUSPECT KNOWLEDGE:
   • Knew exact location of rear exit
   • Took most direct escape route
   • Suggests possible prior surveillance or familiarity

5. EVIDENCE LOCATION:
   • Handbag remains at scene
   • Strap damage visible in footage
   • No physical evidence left by suspect
   • Scene preserved for forensic collectio

╔═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║                   FIRST INFORMATION REPORT (FIR)                              ║
║                    SHIVAJI NAGAR POLICE STATION, PUNE                         ║
╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

FIR REGISTRATION DETAILS:
─────────────────────────
Police Station:          Shivaji Nagar Police Station, Pune
FIR Number:              121/2025
Date of Incident:        16 March 2025
Time of Incident:        21:00 hours (9:00 PM)
FIR Registration Date:   16 March 2025
FIR Registration Time:   21:10 hours (9:10 PM)
Investigating Officer:   Inspector Amit Desai (Badge No: 4521)


COMPLAINANT DETAILS:
──────────────────
Name:                    Neha Deshmukh
Age:                     30 years
Gender:                  Female
Address:                 Flat 102, Sai Apartment, FC Road, Pune - 411004
Phone:                   9765432109
Email:                   neha.deshmukh@email.com
Occupation:              Marketing Manager
Place of Work:           Digital Solutions Ltd, Pune
Years at Location:       3 years


ACCUSED DETAILS:
───────────────
Name:                    Unknown/At Large
Age:                     Approximately 25-30 years
Gender:                  Male
Height:                  Approximately 5'8" (173 cm)
Build:                   Medium/Athletic
Complexion:              Fair (visible in footage)
Distinguishing Marks:    Scar on left cheek (visible in CCTV)
Clothing at Time:        Black hoodie, blue denim jeans
Footwear:                Dark shoes (brand unclear)
Status:                  Unknown, Absconding


INCIDENT NARRATIVE:
──────────────────

On 16 March 2025, at approximately 21:00 hours (9:00 PM), the complainant Neha Deshmukh 
was returning home from office work and walking towards the rear exit of Sai Apartment 
Complex on FC Road, Pune.

As she approached the rear exit, an unknown male wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans 
suddenly emerged from behind a parked vehicle. The accused attempted to snatch the 
complainant's handbag without any provocation or prior interaction.

The complainant, sensing the threat, attempted to resist and hold onto her handbag. 
A brief struggle ensued during which the accused applied physical force, pushing the 
complainant forcefully. The complainant lost her balance and fell to the ground, causing 
injuries to her right shoulder and elbow.

The accused, in his attempt to snatch the handbag, managed to partially damage the strap 
of the bag but did not succeed in stealing the handbag due to the complainant's resistance 
and intervention by a nearby witness.

Upon hearing the complainant's screams, nearby resident Rahul Patil came to her assistance. 
The accused, realizing that help was coming, immediately fled the scene in the direction of 
the main road and disappeared.

The complainant was assisted by the witness and the apartment security guard. Emergency 
medical services were contacted and the complainant was taken to CityCare Hospital for 
medical examination.

The incident was reported to the police station at 21:10 hours (9:10 PM).


WITNESSES:
──────────
1. Rahul Patil
   Age: 41 years, Occupation: Business Executive
   Address: 1st Floor, Sai Apartment, FC Road, Pune
   Contact: 9876543214
   Status: Eye witness (heard screams, observed accused fleeing)

2. Ramesh Singh
   Age: 45 years, Occupation: Security Guard
   Address: Security Booth, Sai Apartment Complex
   Contact: 9876543211
   Status: First responder, assisted complainant
   Note: Same security guard as FIR 118/2025 (Assault case)


SECTIONS OF LAW APPLICABLE:
──────────────────────────
Section 356 IPC - Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft
Section 509 IPC - Word/gesture intended to insult the modesty of a woman
Section 427 IPC - Mischief by injury to property (handbag strap damage)


PROPERTY INVOLVED:
──────────────────
Handbag:
  • Color: Brown leather
  • Estimated Value: 3,500 rupees
  • Contents: Mobile phone, wallet with ID, cosmetics
  • Damage: Strap partially torn/damaged
  • Status: Recovered by complainant


PRELIMINARY INVESTIGATION:
──────────────────────────
1. Detailed statement recorded from complainant - 21:25 hours
2. Witness statement recorded - 21:40 hours
3. CCTV footage retrieved from rear exit camera (CAM-04) - 21:20 hours
4. Scene of crime examined - 21:35 hours
5. Medical examination completed at CityCare Hospital - 22:00 hours
6. Handbag strap collected as evidence - 21:45 hours
7. Forensic examination initiated - 22:15 hours
8. Area search initiated - 21:50 hours


EVIDENCE COLLECTED:
────────────────────
1. Handbag with damaged strap (Exhibit A) - Recovered from scene
2. Forensic swabs from handbag (Exhibit B) - For fiber analysis
3. CCTV footage from CAM-04 (Digital evidence) - For analysis
4. Photographs of injury and scene (Exhibits C-E) - Documentation


ACTION TAKEN:
─────────────
1. Complaint registered under section

╔═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║                         FORENSIC LAB REPORT                                   ║
║                    FORENSIC SCIENCE LABORATORY, PUNE                          ║
╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

REPORT REFERENCE:        FR-LAB/2025/121
CASE REFERENCE:          FIR 121/2025
REQUESTING AGENCY:       Shivaji Nagar Police Station, Pune
REPORT DATE/TIME:        17 March 2025, 14:30 hours (2:30 PM)
EVIDENCE RECEIVED DATE:  16 March 2025, 23:30 hours
ANALYSIS COMPLETED:      17 March 2025, 12:00 hours


LAB IDENTIFICATION:
───────────────────
Laboratory Name:        Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL), Pune
Accreditation:          ISO 17025 Certified
Examiner:              Dr. Suresh Patel, Forensic Expert
License No:            FORSC-2018-3521
Experience:            18 years in forensic analysis
Reviewed By:           Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Senior Forensic Officer
Lab Case No:           FSL-2025-007841


EVIDENCE SUBMITTED FOR EXAMINATION:
────────────────────────────────────

Exhibit A - Handbag with Damaged Strap
─────────────────────────────────────
Description:           Brown leather handbag, medium size
Status on Receipt:      Slightly damaged, strap torn
Sealing Status:        Properly sealed in evidence bag (intact)
Chain of Custody:      Maintained throughout
Condition at Receipt:   Good, no additional damage in transit


DETAILED EXAMINATION & FINDINGS:
──────────────────────────────────

HANDBAG EXAMINATION:
────────────────────

Visual Inspection:
• Material: Genuine brown leather
• Color: Light brown/tan
• Estimated Size: Medium (approximately 10" x 8" x 4")
• Condition: Generally good, appears well-maintained
• Manufacturing: Professional grade, not counterfeit


STRAP DAMAGE ANALYSIS:
─────────────────────

Damage Type:          Tear/rupture of leather strap
Location:             Approximately 3 cm from attachment point (left side)
Damage Pattern:       Linear tear, approximately 5-7 cm in length
Tear Characteristics: Jagged edges indicate sudden forceful pulling
Direction:            Horizontal tear (consistent with lateral pulling force)
Stress Analysis:      Tear shows signs of sudden tensile stress

Forensic Assessment:
The strap damage is entirely consistent with a forceful snatching attempt. The 
jagged edges and tear pattern indicate that the strap was subjected to sudden, 
violent pulling in a lateral direction. This is typical of handbag snatching 
attempts when the victim resists.

The damage indicates that significant force was applied suddenly, rather than a 
gradual weakening of the strap material. This supports the witness and victim 
accounts of a sudden, violent attack.

The location of the tear (near attachment point) is exactly where stress would 
be concentrated during a snatching attempt.


FIBER EVIDENCE ANALYSIS:
────────────────────────

Fibers Recovered:     YES - Present on torn strap area
Fiber Type:          Black synthetic fibers
Fiber Count:         12 distinct fibers recovered
Fiber Length:        3-8 mm
Fiber Color:         Black (consistent with black hoodie)
Fiber Composition:   Polyester blend (typical hoodie material)

Fiber Source Analysis:
The black synthetic fibers are consistent with a black hoodie or similar black 
synthetic garment. The fiber characteristics match common polyester hoodie 
material sold commercially.

The fibers likely transferred from the suspect's clothing during the physical 
struggle and attempted snatching. This is typical trace evidence in violent 
property crimes.


FINGERPRINT EVIDENCE ANALYSIS:
────────────────────────────────

Fingerprint Search Status: UNSUCCESSFUL
Condition:                 No usable fingerprints recovered
Reason for Failure:       Evidence contamination
Analysis:
The handbag strap and surrounding areas were examined for fingerprint evidence 
using standard enhancement techniques (ninhydrin, iodine fuming, cyanoacrylate).

However, no identifiable fingerprints were recovered. This is likely due to:
1. Contamination from multiple handlers (victim, witness, security guard, police)
2. Weather exposure (outdoor incident)
3. Leather surface material (difficult surface for fingerprint recovery)
4. Time delay between incident and evidence collection

While fingerprint evidence would have been valuable, the lack thereof does not 
undermine the strength of other evidence (fiber, CCTV, witness testimony).


TRACE EVIDENCE SUMMARY:
───────────────────────

Evidence Item           | Recovered | Findings
────────────────────────┼───────────┼──────────────────────
Black Synthetic Fibers  | YES (12)  | Consistent with black hoodie
DNA Evidence            | NEGATIVE  | No usable DNA recovered
Biological Evidence     | NONE      | No blood or other biological evidence
Soil/Debris             | NONE      | Clean leather surface
Chemical Residue        | NONE      | None detected


COMPARATIVE EVIDENCE:
───

║                         CITYCARE HOSPITAL, PUNE                               ║
╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

CASE REFERENCE:          CR-5578/2025
HOSPITAL NAME:           CityCare Hospital, Pune
DEPARTMENT:              Emergency & Orthopedics
ADMISSION DATE/TIME:     16 March 2025, 21:50 hours (9:50 PM)
REPORT DATE/TIME:        16 March 2025, 22:30 hours (10:30 PM)


PATIENT DETAILS:
────────────────
Name:                    Neha Deshmukh
Age/Gender:              30 years / Female
Blood Group:             AB+
Father's Name:           Rajesh Deshmukh
Address:                 Flat 102, Sai Apartment, FC Road, Pune - 411004
Phone:                   9765432109
Occupation:              Marketing Manager
Insurance Status:        Corporate Health Insurance Policy


CASE CLASSIFICATION:
──────────────────
Case Type:              Medico-Legal Case (Assault/Attempted Theft)
Category:               Simple Hurt
FIR Number:             121/2025
Police Station:         Shivaji Nagar PS
Case Status:            Reported to Police


EMERGENCY EXAMINATION:
──────────────────────
Time of Arrival:        21:50 hours
Triage Level:           3 (Moderate)
Vital Signs at Admission:
  • Blood Pressure:     130/85 mmHg (slightly elevated due to stress)
  • Heart Rate:         95 beats per minute (elevated)
  • Respiratory Rate:   19 breaths per minute (slightly elevated)
  • Temperature:        37.0°C (Normal)
  • SpO2 (Oxygen):      98% on room air

General Condition:       Conscious and alert, shaken and anxious
Cooperative:             Yes, frightened but cooperative


PRIMARY COMPLAINTS:
──────────────────
Patient complained of pain in right shoulder and right elbow following a forceful push 
during an attempted handbag snatching incident. Patient states she fell to the ground 
after being pushed by an unknown male.


DETAILED CLINICAL EXAMINATION:
──────────────────────────────

HEAD & NECK:
• No visible head injury or lacerations
• Eyes: Normal bilaterally, pupils equal and reacting to light
• Ears: Normal
• Neurological exam: Normal, alert and oriented
• Neck: Normal range of motion, no tenderness

UPPER LIMBS:

RIGHT SHOULDER (Primary Injury):
• Visible bruising: Moderate bruise approximately 6x8 cm
• Location: Anterolateral aspect of right shoulder
• Color: Blue-purple discoloration (indicating recent impact)
• Tenderness: Significant, patient winces on palpation
• Swelling: Mild to moderate swelling in shoulder joint
• Range of Motion: Limited (approximately 50% normal range)
• Pain with Movement: Yes, especially with forward flexion and abduction
• Clinical Diagnosis: Shoulder sprain (Grade I-II), soft tissue injury
• No neurovascular compromise detected

X-ray Findings (Right Shoulder):
  • No fracture detected
  • No dislocation
  • Shoulder joint properly aligned
  • Soft tissue swelling noted
  • Impression: Soft tissue strain, no bony involvement

RIGHT ELBOW (Secondary Injury):
• Bruising: Mild bruise approximately 3x4 cm on posterior aspect
• Color: Slight purple-blue discoloration
• Tenderness: Mild, localized to impact area
• Swelling: Minimal swelling
• Range of Motion: Normal (full active and passive range)
• No fracture or dislocation visible
• Clinical Diagnosis: Minor contusion (bruising only)

LEFT SIDE:
• No visible injuries
• Normal range of motion
• No tenderness

CHEST:
• Symmetrical, no tenderness
• Clear lung sounds bilaterally
• Heart: Regular rhythm
• No rib fractures or injuries

ABDOMEN:
• Soft, non-tender
• No evidence of internal injury
• Normal bowel sounds

LOWER LIMBS:
• No visible injuries
• Normal range of motion

PSYCHOLOGICAL ASSESSMENT:
• Patient experiencing acute stress reaction
• Trembling observed initially, gradually subsiding
• Anxiety and fear evident
• Expressing concern about future safety
• No signs of severe psychological trauma yet


INJURY CLASSIFICATION:
─────────────────────
Nature of Injuries:       Soft tissue injury from forceful push/fall
Type:                     Shoulder sprain (Grade I-II) + Elbow contusion
Severity:                 Simple Hurt (per IPC definition)
Causation:               Consistent with violent push causing fall
Pattern Analysis:        Pattern consistent with assault account


RADIOLOGICAL FINDINGS:
──────────────────────
X-ray Right Shoulder:
  • No fracture or dislocation
  • Soft tissue swelling noted
  • Normal shoulder joint alignment
  • Impression: Soft tissue injury, no bony involvement

Clinical Ultrasound (Optional):
  • Recommended if pain persists beyond 3-5 days
  • To rule out rotator cuff involvement
  • To assess extent of soft tissue damage


TREATMENT PROVIDED:
────────────────────
1. Ice application for 20 minutes (pain and swelling management)
2. Analgesia: Paracetamol 500mg + Ibuprofen 400mg orally
3. Anti-

extracted_content.extracted_text:
╔═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║                         WITNESS STATEMENT                                     ║
║                    SHIVAJI NAGAR POLICE STATION, PUNE                         ║
╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

CASE REFERENCE:  FIR 121/2025
WITNESS NAME:    Rahul Patil
STATEMENT DATE:  16 March 2025
TIME OF STATEMENT: 21:40 hours


WITNESS IDENTIFICATION:
──────────────────────
Name:                    Rahul Patil
Age:                     41 years
Gender:                  Male
Father's Name:           Suresh Patil
Address:                 Flat 101, 1st Floor, Sai Apartment, FC Road, Pune - 411004
Phone:                   9876543214
Email:                   rahul.patil@email.com
Occupation:              Business Executive (Import/Export)
Years at Location:       5 years
Citizenship:             Indian
ID Proof:                Voter ID (3847 XXXX XXXX 1245)


STATEMENT IN FIRST PERSON:
──────────────────────────

On 16 March 2025, at approximately 9:00 PM (21:00 hours), I was in my apartment 
(Flat 101, 1st Floor) when I heard a loud, piercing scream coming from outside. The 
scream was clearly in a woman's voice and sounded like she was in distress. It was 
not just a casual noise—it had an urgency that made me immediately concerned for 
someone's safety.

I quickly stepped out onto my balcony to see what was happening. From my vantage point 
on the first floor, I could see the rear exit area of the apartment complex. I observed 
a man wearing a distinctive black hoodie running towards the main road at a very fast 
pace, clearly in a hurry to escape.

The man had a lean, athletic build and appeared to be relatively young—I would estimate 
in his late 20s or early 30s. His face was partially obscured by the hoodie, but I could 
see he had a fair complexion and what appeared to be a scar on his left cheek. He was 
wearing blue denim jeans and dark-colored shoes.

As I watched him run away, I noticed a woman (later identified as Neha Deshmukh) lying 
on the ground near the rear exit, crying and seemingly in pain. She appeared to have 
fallen or been pushed. I immediately understood that this young man had likely attacked 
or robbed her, which is why she was screaming and he was fleeing so desperately.

I quickly came down from my balcony and rushed to help her. When I reached her, she was 
holding her right shoulder and elbow, which had visible injuries from the fall. She was 
clearly shocked and traumatized by the incident. I asked her what happened, and she 
explained that a man had tried to snatch her handbag, pushed her during the struggle, 
and caused her to fall.

I helped her stand up carefully, being mindful of her injuries. I also noticed that her 
handbag's strap was damaged, consistent with her account of a snatching attempt. She was 
still holding onto her bag, which suggested she had successfully resisted the thief's 
attempt.

After helping her up, I immediately called for the apartment's security guard (Ramesh 
Singh) to come to the rear exit. The security guard arrived within minutes and we provided 
first aid comfort and support to Neha while waiting for emergency services.

During this time, I looked around the rear exit area and did not see any other suspicious 
persons or items left behind. The area appeared to be the scene of a brief, violent 
altercation.


KEY OBSERVATIONS:
─────────────────
• Young male, athletic build, estimated 25-30 years old
• Distinctive black hoodie (primary identifying feature)
• Blue denim jeans
• Dark shoes (brand unclear from distance)
• Visible scar on left cheek (clear identifying mark)
• Fair complexion
• Ran away at high speed toward main road
• No weapon visible, but used physical force (pushing)
• Appeared to be familiar with the escape route (ran directly toward main road)
• The man seemed to know the layout of the complex


TIMELINE OF EVENTS:
────────────────────
Time 21:00 (9:00 PM):    Heard woman screaming from rear exit area
Time 21:01 (9:01 PM):    Stepped onto balcony and observed man in black hoodie running
Time 21:02 (9:02 PM):    Observed injured woman on ground, realized assault had occurred
Time 21:03 (9:03 PM):    Rushed down to help the woman
Time 21:04 (9:04 PM):    Called security guard to the scene
Time 21:05 (9:05 PM):    Security guard arrived and we provided assistance
Time 21:10 (9:10 PM):    Police called and complaint registered


SUSPECT DESCRIPTION (DETAILED):
────────────────────────────────
Age:                     Approximately 25-30 years
Gender:                  Male
Height:                  Approximately 5'8" to 5'10" (medium height)
Build:                   Lean but athletic/muscular appearance
Complexion:              Fair/Light
Hair:                    Partially hidden by hoodie, appeared dark brown/black
Facial Hair:             Could not see clearly due to hoodie
Distinguishing Marks:    Scar on left

evidence_map.consolidated_text:
╔═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║                  CCTV SURVEILLANCE ANALYSIS REPORT                            ║
║                    SAI APARTMENT COMPLEX, PUNE                                ║
╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

REPORT REFERENCE:        CCTV-16-MAR-2025-002
REPORT DATE/TIME:        16 March 2025, 22:00 hours
CASE REFERENCE:          FIR 121/2025
INCIDENT DATE:           16 March 2025


SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM DETAILS:
────────────────────────────
System Type:             HD IP Camera Network
Number of Cameras:       6 (covering complex)
Primary Camera:          CAM-04 (Rear Exit)
Resolution:              1920 x 1080 pixels (Full HD)
Frame Rate:              30 frames per second (fps)
Recording Format:        H.264 Video Codec
Storage:                 Digital Video Recorder (DVR)
Recording Period:        24/7 continuous


CAMERA SPECIFICATIONS (CAM-04):
───────────────────────────────
Camera Type:             Fixed Dome IP Camera
Model:                   Hikvision DS-2CD2143G0-I
Field of View:           90 degrees (Horizontal)
Focal Length:            2.8mm
Night Vision:            Infrared (IR) - 30 meters
Resolution:              1920 x 1080 @ 30fps
Installation Location:   Rear exit entrance, height 2.5 meters


VIDEO ANALYSIS TIME WINDOW:
────────────────────────────
Total Duration Analyzed: 30 minutes (20:50 PM - 21:20 PM)
Critical Incident Period: 21:02 PM - 21:04 PM (2 minutes)
Video Quality:           Clear, good lighting conditions
Lighting Conditions:     Outdoor evening, building exterior lights on


TIMELINE OF EVENTS (FROM CCTV ANALYSIS):
─────────────────────────────────────────

TIME: 21:02 PM (21:02 hours)
EVENT: Unknown male approaches rear exit area
DESCRIPTION:
  • Male wearing black hoodie (very distinctive)
  • Blue denim jeans
  • Dark shoes
  • Height approximately 5'8"-5'10"
  • Build: Athletic/lean
  • Walking with purpose toward rear exit
  • Face partially obscured by hoodie hood
  • Visible scar on left cheek (clearly visible in footage)
  • Appears to be waiting or watching before approaching

TIME: 21:03 PM (21:03 hours)
EVENT: Neha Deshmukh enters frame at rear exit
DESCRIPTION:
  • Female walking toward apartment building from street
  • Carrying brown leather handbag
  • Casual walking pace
  • Appears unaware of male's presence
  • Walking alone

TIME: 21:03:15 PM *** CRITICAL MOMENT ***
EVENT: Accused suddenly approaches victim and attempts handbag snatch
DESCRIPTION:
  • Male suddenly closes distance to victim
  • Aggressive movement toward handbag
  • Reaches for victim's handbag with both hands
  • Victim resists immediately, tries to retain handbag
  • Struggle ensues (approximately 10-15 seconds)

TIME: 21:03:30 PM
EVENT: Accused pushes victim forcefully
DESCRIPTION:
  • Male applies forceful push to victim's upper body
  • Push directed toward right shoulder/chest area
  • Victim falls backward to ground
  • Victim lands hard on right side (shoulder and elbow impact)
  • Accused attempts to grab handbag during fall

TIME: 21:03:45 PM
EVENT: Victim retains handbag despite fall
DESCRIPTION:
  • Despite fall, victim maintains grip on handbag
  • Victim on ground, holding handbag to body
  • Handbag strap appears damaged/torn
  • Accused realizes theft unsuccessful

TIME: 21:04 PM
EVENT: Accused flees scene
DESCRIPTION:
  • Accused abandons snatching attempt
  • Runs away from scene at high speed
  • Direction: Toward main road (FC Road)
  • Speed: Approximately 15-20 km/h
  • Does not look back
  • Quickly exits camera frame

TIME: 21:05 PM
EVENT: Witness assistance and first responders
DESCRIPTION:
  • Witness (Rahul Patil) enters frame from building
  • Rushes to assist fallen victim
  • Security guard appears on scene
  • Emergency services likely contacted


KEY FORENSIC OBSERVATIONS:
───────────────────────────
1. SUSPECT IDENTIFICATION:
   • Clear facial view in multiple frames
   • Distinctive black hoodie (primary identifier)
   • Visible scar on left cheek (precise identifier)
   • Build, height, gait all recorded
   • Positive identification possible if suspect apprehended

2. ATTACK PATTERN:
   • Single, rapid attack (total duration ~2 minutes)
   • Sudden approach suggests either waiting or exceptional timing
   • No hesitation or uncertainty in criminal action
   • Suggests prior experience or observation

3. VICTIM'S RESISTANCE:
   • Victim immediately resisted (positive action)
   • Did not comply with thief's demands
   • Successfully retained handbag despite fall
   • Victim's presence of mind prevented successful theft

4. SUSPECT KNOWLEDGE:
   • Knew exact location of rear exit
   • Took most direct escape route
   • Suggests possible prior surveillance or familiarity

5. EVIDENCE LOCATION:
   • Handbag remains at scene
   • Strap damage visible in footage
   • No physical evidence left by suspect
   • Scene preserved for forensic collection


VIDEO INTEGRITY:
─────────────────
All footage verified as authentic and unedited
Recording continuous with no gaps or interruptions
Time stamps synchronized with incident reports
No evidence of tampering detected
Digital metadata preserved


FORENSIC TIMELINE ACCURACY:
────────────────────────────
CCTV Timeline:           21:02 - 21:04 PM
Witness Account:         "Around 9 PM" (21:00 approximately)
Victim's Account:        "Around 9 PM" (21:00 approximately)
Medical Admission:       21:50 hours
Police Report Time:      21:10 hours

All sources consistent within reasonable margin (CCTV provides precise timing)


COMPARATIVE ANALYSIS (WITH FIR 118/2025 - ASSAULT CASE):
──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Location:                Same (Sai Apartment, FC Road)
Time Gap:                48 hours (14 March vs 16 March)
Suspect Description:     Different person (assault was older, ~28 years)
Crime Type:              Different (assault with knife vs handbag snatch)
Weapon:                  No weapon in this case (physical force only)
Witness Involvement:     Same security guard (Ramesh Singh)
Pattern:                 Possible pattern of targeting apartment complex

Conclusion: Likely INDEPENDENT incidents, but targeting same location suggests 
            possible security vulnerability in complex


CRITICAL EVIDENCE EXTRACTED:
────────────────────────────
1. Frame 21:03:00 - Suspect approaching victim
2. Frame 21:03:15 - Snatching attempt beginning
3. Frame 21:03:30 - Forceful push of victim
4. Frame 21:03:45 - Victim falls with injury
5. Frame 21:04:00 - Suspect fleeing scene
6. Multiple frames clearly showing suspect's face and scar


VIDEO REPORT CERTIFICATION:
────────────────────────────
This report certifies that the above analysis is based on authentic, unedited, 
and verified CCTV footage from Sai Apartment Complex, Camera CAM-04.


Analyzed and Certified By:
_____________________________
Mr. Suresh Desai
CCTV Surveillance Expert
License No: CCTV-2019-4521
NASSCOM Certified Professional

Reviewed By:
_____________________________
Inspector Amit Desai
Shivaji Nagar Police Station
Badge No: 4521

Date: 16 March 2025, 22:00 hours

---

╔═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║                   FIRST INFORMATION REPORT (FIR)                              ║
║                    SHIVAJI NAGAR POLICE STATION, PUNE                         ║
╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

FIR REGISTRATION DETAILS:
─────────────────────────
Police Station:          Shivaji Nagar Police Station, Pune
FIR Number:              121/2025
Date of Incident:        16 March 2025
Time of Incident:        21:00 hours (9:00 PM)
FIR Registration Date:   16 March 2025
FIR Registration Time:   21:10 hours (9:10 PM)
Investigating Officer:   Inspector Amit Desai (Badge No: 4521)


COMPLAINANT DETAILS:
──────────────────
Name:                    Neha Deshmukh
Age:                     30 years
Gender:                  Female
Address:                 Flat 102, Sai Apartment, FC Road, Pune - 411004
Phone:                   9765432109
Email:                   neha.deshmukh@email.com
Occupation:              Marketing Manager
Place of Work:           Digital Solutions Ltd, Pune
Years at Location:       3 years


ACCUSED DETAILS:
───────────────
Name:                    Unknown/At Large
Age:                     Approximately 25-30 years
Gender:                  Male
Height:                  Approximately 5'8" (173 cm)
Build:                   Medium/Athletic
Complexion:              Fair (visible in footage)
Distinguishing Marks:    Scar on left cheek (visible in CCTV)
Clothing at Time:        Black hoodie, blue denim jeans
Footwear:                Dark shoes (brand unclear)
Status:                  Unknown, Absconding


INCIDENT NARRATIVE:
──────────────────

On 16 March 2025, at approximately 21:00 hours (9:00 PM), the complainant Neha Deshmukh 
was returning home from office work and walking towards the rear exit of Sai Apartment 
Complex on FC Road, Pune.

As she approached the rear exit, an unknown male wearing a black hoodie and blue jeans 
suddenly emerged from behind a parked vehicle. The accused attempted to snatch the 
complainant's handbag without any provocation or prior interaction.

The complainant, sensing the threat, attempted to resist and hold onto her handbag. 
A brief struggle ensued during which the accused applied physical force, pushing the 
complainant forcefully. The complainant lost her balance and fell to the ground, causing 
injuries to her right shoulder and elbow.

The accused, in his attempt to snatch the handbag, managed to partially damage the strap 
of the bag but did not succeed in stealing the handbag due to the complainant's resistance 
and intervention by a nearby witness.

Upon hearing the complainant's screams, nearby resident Rahul Patil came to her assistance. 
The accused, realizing that help was coming, immediately fled the scene in the direction of 
the main road and disappeared.

The complainant was assisted by the witness and the apartment security guard. Emergency 
medical services were contacted and the complainant was taken to CityCare Hospital for 
medical examination.

The incident was reported to the police station at 21:10 hours (9:10 PM).


WITNESSES:
──────────
1. Rahul Patil
   Age: 41 years, Occupation: Business Executive
   Address: 1st Floor, Sai Apartment, FC Road, Pune
   Contact: 9876543214
   Status: Eye witness (heard screams, observed accused fleeing)

2. Ramesh Singh
   Age: 45 years, Occupation: Security Guard
   Address: Security Booth, Sai Apartment Complex
   Contact: 9876543211
   Status: First responder, assisted complainant
   Note: Same security guard as FIR 118/2025 (Assault case)


SECTIONS OF LAW APPLICABLE:
──────────────────────────
Section 356 IPC - Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft
Section 509 IPC - Word/gesture intended to insult the modesty of a woman
Section 427 IPC - Mischief by injury to property (handbag strap damage)


PROPERTY INVOLVED:
──────────────────
Handbag:
  • Color: Brown leather
  • Estimated Value: 3,500 rupees
  • Contents: Mobile phone, wallet with ID, cosmetics
  • Damage: Strap partially torn/damaged
  • Status: Recovered by complainant


PRELIMINARY INVESTIGATION:
──────────────────────────
1. Detailed statement recorded from complainant - 21:25 hours
2. Witness statement recorded - 21:40 hours
3. CCTV footage retrieved from rear exit camera (CAM-04) - 21:20 hours
4. Scene of crime examined - 21:35 hours
5. Medical examination completed at CityCare Hospital - 22:00 hours
6. Handbag strap collected as evidence - 21:45 hours
7. Forensic examination initiated - 22:15 hours
8. Area search initiated - 21:50 hours


EVIDENCE COLLECTED:
────────────────────
1. Handbag with damaged strap (Exhibit A) - Recovered from scene
2. Forensic swabs from handbag (Exhibit B) - For fiber analysis
3. CCTV footage from CAM-04 (Digital evidence) - For analysis
4. Photographs of injury and scene (Exhibits C-E) - Documentation


ACTION TAKEN:
─────────────
1. Complaint registered under sections 356, 509, 427 IPC
2. Complainant provided immediate medical care
3. Witness statements recorded in detail
4. Scene of crime photographed and documented
5. CCTV footage secured for forensic analysis
6. Suspect description circulated to local patrols
7. Case classified as "Open" - Active Investigation
8. Coordination initiated with FIR 118/2025 (previous Sai Apartment incident)


CASE ANALYSIS & OBSERVATIONS:
──────────────────────────────
• Second incident in Sai Apartment complex within 2 days
• Same security guard (Ramesh Singh) involved in both cases
• Same location (Sai Apartment, FC Road, Pune)
• Different crime type but same neighborhood
• Possible pattern or organized targeting of residents
• Recommend increased security measures in complex
• Possible relationship between incidents to be investigated


INVESTIGATING OFFICER'S REMARKS:
────────────────────────────────
This appears to be a case of attempted theft involving criminal force and intimidation. 
The suspect is young, athletic, and showed no hesitation in using physical force. The 
presence of a visible scar on the left cheek makes identification possible if suspect 
apprehended. The incident's occurrence in a residential complex raises concern about 
security vulnerabilities. The second incident at the same location within 48 hours 
warrants coordinated investigation with FIR 118/2025.

The suspect's familiarity with the rear exit (approaching from concealment behind 
parked vehicle) suggests possible prior knowledge of the location, indicating possible 
targeting or surveillance of the complex.


Signature of Investigating Officer:     _____________________
Date: 16 March 2025
Time: 21:10 hours

Name: Inspector Amit Desai
Badge No: 4521
Shivaji Nagar Police Station, Pune

---

╔═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╗
║                         FORENSIC LAB REPORT                                   ║
║                    FORENSIC SCIENCE LABORATORY, PUNE                          ║
╚═══════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════╝

REPORT REFERENCE:        FR-LAB/2025/121
CASE REFERENCE:          FIR 121/2025
REQUESTING AGENCY:       Shivaji Nagar Police Station, Pune
REPORT DATE/TIME:        17 March 2025, 14:30 hours (2:30 PM)
EVIDENCE RECEIVED DATE:  16 March 2025, 23:30 hours
ANALYSIS COMPLETED:      17 March 2025, 12:00 hours


LAB IDENTIFICATION:
───────────────────
Laboratory Name:        Forensic Science Laboratory (FSL), Pune
Accreditation:          ISO 17025 Certified
Examiner:              Dr. Suresh Patel, Forensic Expert
License No:            FORSC-2018-3521
Experience:            18 years in forensic analysis
Reviewed By:           Dr. Rajesh Kumar, Senior Forensic Officer
Lab Case No:           FSL-2025-007841


EVIDENCE SUBMITTED FOR EXAMINATION:
────────────────────────────────────

Exhibit A - Handbag with Damaged Strap
─────────────────────────────────────
Description:           Brown leather handbag, medium size
Status on Receipt:      Slightly damaged, strap torn
Sealing Status:        Properly sealed in evidence bag (intact)
Chain of Custody:      Maintained throughout
Condition at Receipt:   Good, no additional damage in transit


DETAILED EXAMINATION & FINDINGS:
──────────────────────────────────

HANDBAG EXAMINATION:
────────────────────

Visual Inspection:
• Material: Genuine brown leather
• Color: Light brown/tan
• Estimated Size: Medium (approximately 10" x 8" x 4")
• Condition: Generally good, appears well-maintained
• Manufacturing: Professional grade, not counterfeit


STRAP DAMAGE ANALYSIS:
─────────────────────

Damage Type:          Tear/rupture of leather strap
Location:             Approximately 3 cm from attachment point (left side)
Damage Pattern:       Linear tear, approximately 5-7 cm in length
Tear Characteristics: Jagged edges indicate sudden forceful pulling
Direction:            Horizontal tear (consistent with lateral pulling force)
Stress Analysis:      Tear shows signs of sudden tensile stress

Forensic Assessment:
The strap damage is entirely consistent with a forceful snatching attempt. The 
jagged edges and tear pattern indicate that the strap was subjected to sudden, 
violent pulling in a lateral direction. This is typical of handbag snatching 
attempts when the victim resists.

The damage indicates that significant force was applied suddenly, rather than a 
gradual weakening of the strap material. This supports the witness and victim 
accounts of a sudden, violent attack.

The location of the tear (near attachment point) is exactly where stress would 
be concentrated during a snatching attempt.


FIBER EVIDENCE ANALYSIS:
────────────────────────

Fibers Recovered:     YES - Present on torn strap area
Fiber Type:          Black synthetic fibers
Fiber Count:         12 distinct fibers recovered
Fiber Length:        3-8 mm
Fiber Color:         Black (consistent with black hoodie)
Fiber Composition:   Polyester blend (typical hoodie material)

Fiber Source Analysis:
The black synthetic fibers are consistent with a black hoodie or similar black 
synthetic garment. The fiber characteristics match common polyester hoodie 
material sold commercially.

The fibers likely transferred from the suspect's clothing during the physical 
struggle and attempted snatching. This is typical trace evidence in violent 
property crimes.


FINGERPRINT EVIDENCE ANALYSIS:
────────────────────────────────

Fingerprint Search Status: UNSUCCESSFUL
Condition:                 No usable fingerprints recovered
Reason for Failure:       Evidence contamination
Analysis:
The handbag strap and surrounding areas were examined for fingerprint evidence 
using standard enhancement techniques (ninhydrin, iodine fuming, cyanoacrylate).

However, no identifiable fingerprints were recovered. This is likely due to:
1. Contamination from multiple handlers (victim, witness, security guard, police)
2. Weather exposure (outdoor incident)
3. Leather surface material (difficult surface for fingerprint recovery)
4. Time delay between incident and evidence collection

While fingerprint evidence would have been valuable, the lack thereof does not 
undermine the strength of other evidence (fiber, CCTV, witness testimony).


TRACE EVIDENCE SUMMARY:
───────────────────────

Evidence Item           | Recovered | Findings
────────────────────────┼───────────┼──────────────────────
Black Synthetic Fibers  | YES (12)  | Consistent with black hoodie
DNA Evidence            | NEGATIVE  | No usable DNA recovered
Biological Evidence     | NONE      | No blood or other biological evidence
Soil/Debris             | NONE      | Clean leather surface
Chemical Residue        | NONE      | None detected


COMPARATIVE EVIDENCE:
──────────────────────

Suspect Description (from CCTV/Witness):
• Black hoodie
• Synthetic material
• Athletic build

Recovered Fiber Evidence:
• Black synthetic material
• Polyester blend
• Consistent with hoodie material

Comparison Result:      CONSISTENT ✓
Probability:           High degree of consistency with suspect's clothing


FORENSIC CONCLUSIONS:
──────────────────────

1. PRIMARY FINDING:
   The handbag strap damage is consistent with a forceful snatching attempt. 
   The tear pattern, location, and physical characteristics all support this 
   conclusion.

2. FIBER EVIDENCE:
   The black synthetic fibers recovered from the handbag are consistent with 
   transfer from a black hoodie worn by the suspect during the violent 
   altercation.

3. INCIDENT RECONSTRUCTION:
   The forensic evidence supports the following sequence of events:
   • Suspect approached victim at rear exit
   • Suspect grabbed handbag with force
   • Suspect and victim engaged in struggle over handbag
   • During struggle, fibers fro

SURVEILLANCE SYSTEM DETAILS:
────────────────────────────

TIMELINE OF EVENTS (FROM CCTV ANALYSIS):
─────────────────────────────────────────

TIME: 21:02 PM (21:02 hours)
EVENT: Unknown male approaches rear exit area
DESCRIPTION:
  • Male wearing black hoodie (very distinctive)
  • Blue denim jeans
  • Dark shoes
  • Height approximately 5'8"-5'10"
  • Build: Athletic/lean
  • Walking with purpose toward rear exit
  • Face partially obscured by hoodie hood
  • Visible scar on left cheek (clearly visible in footage)
  • Appears to be waiting or watching before approaching

TIME: 21:03 PM (21:03 hours)
EVENT: Neha Deshmukh enters frame at rear exit
DESCRIPTION:
  • Female walking toward apartment building from street
  • Carrying brown leather handbag
  • Casual walking pace
  • Appears unaware of male's presence
  • Walking alone

TIME: 21:03:15 PM *** CRITICAL MOMENT ***
EVENT: Accused suddenly approaches victim and attempts handbag snatch
DESCRIPTION:
  • Male suddenly closes distance to victim
  • Aggressive movement toward handbag
  • Reaches for victim's handbag with both hands
  • Victim resists immediately, tries to retain handbag
  • Struggle ensues (approximately 10-15 seconds)

TIME: 21:03:30 PM
EVENT: Accused pushes victim forcefully
DESCRIPTION:
  • Male applies forceful push to victim's upper body
  • Push directed toward right shoulder/chest area
  • Victim falls backward to ground
  • Victim lands hard on right side (shoulder and elbow impact)
  • Accused attempts to grab handbag during fall

TIME: 21:03:45 PM
EVENT: Victim retains handbag despite fall
DESCRIPTION:
  • Despite fall, victim maintains grip on handbag
  • Victim on ground, holding handbag to body
  • Handbag strap appears damaged/torn
  • Accused realizes theft unsuccessful

TIME: 21:04 PM
EVENT: Accused flees scene
DESCRIPTION:
  • Accused abandons snatching attempt
  • Runs away from scene at high speed
  • Direction: Toward main road (FC Road)
  • Speed: Approximately 15-20 km/h
  • Does not look back
  • Quickly exits camera frame

TIME: 21:05 PM
EVENT: Witness assistance and first responders
DESCRIPTION:
  • Witness (Rahul Patil) enters frame from building
  • Rushes to assist fallen victim
  • Security guard appears on scene
  • Emergency services likely contacted
